intro: Rauvolfia decurva, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a climbing perennial plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in Ayurvedic and indigenous medicine.
